result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard G Mundy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Shall meet with treating psychiatrist/psychologist within 2 weeks of 8/6/15 and must take all prescribed medications as prescribed on time

Shall have no contact or communication with JRT;  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone;   Shall have no contact or communication with Riverview Park unless under the care/supervision of his mother.

Case called along with 14CF341 and 14CF348.  Defendant Richard G. Mundy in court with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's parents both appeared in the Courtroom.  State is Victims Right compliant.  Parties have a stipulation to resolve all cases. Ct. reviewed CPR and PQWOR and heard defendant's pleas as follows:  14CF171, Ct. 1- No Contest. 14CF341, Cts. 1, 3, 4 and 5-No Contest and 14CF348, Ct. 1-No Contest.     
In 14CF341, the Court found plea(s) given FKVI to Count 1, accepted plea(s), but does not find him guilty and places him on a DPA for 3 years. As to Counts 3, 4, and 5, the Court found Def. guilty of the in Am. Information.   Count 2 DRI. 
In 14CF348, the Court found plea given FKVI to Count 1, accepted plea and found him guilty. Counts 2 and 3 DRI. 
In 14CF171, the Court found plea given FKVI to Count 1, accepted plea and found him guilty.  Count 2 DRI. 
New pending case, 2015DD001393, Carrying a Concealed Weapon, is DRI today.  
Court found a factual basis and heard from State and Defense and sentenced him as follows:
14CF341, Defendant is placed on a DPA for three years with terms for Ct. 1-Burglary,  Count 2-DRI, on Counts 3&4, six months on EACH count, consecutive, comm. 9-18-15; Review Hrg. on 12-18-15.  As to Count 5-DC-Costs only. As to Counts 3, 4 & 5, SW-3 years of probation, restitution and costs.  
14CF171, SW, 3 years probation (concurrent with 14CF341), AODA assessment, treatment/followthru as recommended, and court costs. 
14CF348, SW, 3 years probation (concurrent with 14CF171 & 341), No contact with J.R.T., No VA contact with anyone, and Court costs.  May not request expungement for the misd. charges. 
Defendant is to see his treating psychiatrist/psychologist withint 2 weeks of 8-6-2015 and must take all prescribed medications as prescribed on time.  
No contact whatsoever with Riverview Park unless under the care/supervision of his mother.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 08-06-2015 03:00 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Richard G. Mundy in court, in custody with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Mayer is heard, Mr. Mundy has picked up two new cases (14CF348 and 14CF341), requests competency evaluation.  Atty. Mayer is challenging competency on all three cases.  Court calls 14CF348 and 14CF341.  Court orders competency evals on all cases.  Preliminary hearings removed.  All cases will be heard in Branch 1 on competency issue.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with JRT, dob 1/10/98.  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

(1:40) Defendant Richard G. Mundy in custody via video with attorney Greg E. Vollan (will appoint).  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. State requests $2500 cash bond; Prelim requested within  time limits. Prelim 11/13/14 at 8:30am in Br. 2; Court sets bond at $500.00 CASH BOND with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with JRT, dob 1/10/98.  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.
